name: Three Digits
description: Three Digits is the sequel to our first game Two Digits. You are given 14 numbers less than 1000, and all you have to do is to choose two subsets with the same sum.

reviews.review_text: Raging but epic. Great gamefor like a few hours ago

3.9/10 - A Difficult Math Based Puzzler for Nerds  This isn't a bad game and I do enjoy some difficult puzzlers but this is a wee bit too much for me to enjoy! I like to be challenged but this Math based game proves to be too much! On a positive note there are over 500 of these puzzles, cards and achievements.  You are provided with 10 numbers ranging from 1-999; the range increases as the puzzles get more difficult. You have to highlight these numbers either red or green in order to make these 2 groups 'sum' equal each other.   If this information doesn't get your blood pumping, don't worry that's normal. There is no tutorial so come into this one with the mindset that these puzzles won't be breezed though. There is a problem solver website that can help you once you have been mentally defeated.   Itâ€™s worth $1-3 based on the length. Only buy this if you like hard math based puzzles!     Accidently Reviewed
Even worse than the original, mainly due to the ramped up difficulty. You might like it if you're really into addition I guess.
